intro: Pultenaea squarrosa, commonly known as the squarrosa bush peacockwood, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its slender, often multi-branched stems. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, which appear in spring. Its leaves are typically narrow and have a rough, serrated texture. Pultenaea squarrosa is often found in heathlands and open forests, thriving in well-drained soils.
